content: cast on 72 stitches and begin working the cuff as k2 p2 for 1 25 inches or desired length i have used the cable co method in the pictured socks as i like the finished edge but you can use whatever stretchy co method you like when cuff is done begin working the fair isle pattern make sure to keep your gauge loose as you re working the fair isle row work 7 complete repeats row 1-9 of the fair isle pattern for the leg of the sock and then 3 more rounds of the multicolor place stitches on waste yarn if necessary and try on make sure that they will slide over your heel do not break or cut the multicolor yarn you ll pick it back up later if it s a snug getting over the heel don t worry the heel is designed to be stretchy so that will help with the fit heel flap you will now be dividing your sock into 2 sections and working the heel flap back and forth place the instep on a holder or scrap yarn if desired and do not work for now turn and attach yarn for the heel and row 1 ws sl 1 wyif p 34 k1 turn row 2 rs sl 1 wyib k1 to last 2 stitches end sl 1 wyib p1 turn repeat these two row 18 times in total turn heel after the flap has been made turn the heel by ending with a row 2 and turning to have the ws facing you row 1 sl 1 p 20 p2tog p1 turn row 2 sl 1 k 7 ssk k1 turn row 3 sl 1 p 8 p2tog p1 turn row 4 sl 1 k 9 ssk k1 turn row 5 sl 1 p 10 p2tog p1 turn continue in this fashion decreasing over your gap each time until all stitches have been used up you should have 22 st remaining and be at the end of the rs row ready to pick up the heel st on the left side of the flap pick up 19 st from the left side of the heel flap with the sole or right side facing you you will be picking up the purl bumps that span the edge of the flap after 19 of those pick up 2 st more from the gap located at the beginning of the instep k across these newly picked up stitches to the instep on your holder with your solid heel yarn when you get to the instep your multicolor yarn should be there waiting for you so break the solid yarn you used for the heel and pick up and use the multicolor yarn knit 3 complete rounds with the multicolor as you start with row 1 of the fair isle pattern again and while you are setting up for the gusset decreases note that you will have 6 consecutive rounds of multicolor yarn at the ankle
